coredata.dc:description:
Abstract
EXAFS measurements are reported for NiCl2 and Ni(N03)2 aqueous solutions with molar concentrations of about 4, and for crystalline Ni(N03)2·6H2O. A comparative analysis of the Fourier filtered spectra confirms that the first coordination sphere essentially consists of water molecules. No evidence was found for outer-sphere Cl− ions approaching closely the inner sphere in NiCI2 solution.

The behaviour of the curves is typical of a regular single-shell contribution which does not overlap with others from longer distances as would be the case, in the NiCI^ solution, if a significant number of Cl" ions closely approached the inner sphere. Our conclusion is therefore that in both solutions, the first coordination shell of Mi2"'" essentially consists of water molecules, as repeatedly confirmed by dif- ferent authors [4—9,14].
